00056       DiscreteFunction(ValType val=0)
00057          : vars_i(0), size_i(0), values_i(1,val) { }
00058 
00068       template<class VarIt> DiscreteFunction
00069       (
00070        VarIt begin,
00071        VarIt end,
00072        ValType val=0
00073       )
00074       : vars_i(begin,end), size_i(end-begin), values_i(0)
00075       {
00076          //*********************************************************************
00077          // Ensure that the variable ids are sorted.
00078          //*********************************************************************
00079          std::sort(vars_i.begin(),vars_i.end());
00080 
00081          //*********************************************************************
00082          // Cache the size of each variable, and from this, calculate
00083          // the total capacity required for the data array.
00084          //*********************************************************************
00085          ValIndex totalSize = 1;
00086          for(int k=0; k<vars_i.size(); k++)
00087          {
00088             size_i[k] = getDomainSize(vars_i[k]);
00089             totalSize *= size_i[k];
00090          }
00091 
00092          //*********************************************************************
00093          // Initialise the data array
00094          //*********************************************************************
00095          values_i.assign(totalSize,val);
00096 
00097       } // DiscreteFunction constructor
00098 
00105       DiscreteFunction(VarID var, ValType val)
00106          : vars_i(1,var), size_i(1,getDomainSize(var)),
00107            values_i(getDomainSize(var),val) {}
00108 
00113       DiscreteFunction(const DiscreteFunction& val)
00114          : vars_i(val.vars_i), size_i(val.size_i), values_i(val.values_i) {}

00120       {

00282       template<class VecIt> DiscreteFunction& add(VecIt begin, VecIt end)
00283       {
00284          for(VecIt it=begin; it!=end; ++it)
00285          {
00286             (*this) += *it;
00287          }
00288          return *this;

00376       template<class IndIt> ValType& operator()(IndIt begin, IndIt end)
00377       {
00378          ValIndex ind = sub2ind(size_i.begin(),size_i.end(),begin,end);
00379          return values_i[ind];

00398       template<class VarIt, class IndIt> ValType& operator()
00399          (VarIt varBegin, VarIt varEnd, IndIt indBegin, IndIt indEnd)
00400       {
00401          //*********************************************************************
00402          // Create vector to hold indices on which this function actually
00403          // depends
00404          //*********************************************************************
00405          std::vector<ValIndex> indices;
00406          indices.reserve(vars_i.size());
00407 
00408          assert(0==indices.size()); // sanity check for expected behaviour
00409 
00410          //*********************************************************************
00411          // Retrieve the indices that this function actually depends on.
00412          // Notice this code assumes that all variable lists are sorted.
00413          //*********************************************************************
00414          VarIt v = varBegin;
00415          IndIt i = indBegin;
00416          std::vector<VarID>::const_iterator myV = vars_i.begin();
00417          while( (i != indEnd) && (v != varEnd) && (myV != vars_i.end()) )
00418          {
00419             //******************************************************************
00420             // If input variable is in the domain for this function...
00421             //******************************************************************
00422             if(*v==*myV)
00423             {
00424                //***************************************************************
00425                // Store the specified subindex for this variable
00426                //***************************************************************
00427                indices.push_back(*i);
00428                
00429                //***************************************************************
00430                // Look for the next variable in this functions domain
00431                //***************************************************************
00432                ++myV;
00433             }
00434 
00435             //******************************************************************
00436             // Move to next variable in the parameter list
00437             //******************************************************************
00438             ++v;
00439             ++i;
00440 
00441          } // while loop
00442 
00443          //*********************************************************************
00444          // Throw an exception if the domain is not fully specified
00445          //*********************************************************************
00446          if(vars_i.size() != indices.size())
00447          {
00448             const char* const where = "DiscreteFunction::operator"
00449                "(VarIt,VarIt,IndIt,IndIt)";
00450             const char* const msg = "Domain not subset of variable list";
00451             throw BadDomainException(where,msg);
00452          }
00453 
00454          //*********************************************************************
00455          // Otherwise return the correct value
00456          //*********************************************************************
00457          return (*this)(indices.begin(),indices.end());
00458 
00459       } // operator()
00460

00468       {
00469          // throw away const to use the non-const implementation
00470          DiscreteFunction* me = const_cast<DiscreteFunction*>(this);
00471          return (*me)(varBegin,varEnd,indBegin,indEnd);
00472       }

00480          (VarVec var, IndVec ind)
00481       {
00482          return (*this)(var.begin(),var.end(),ind.begin(),ind.end());

00544       void swap(DiscreteFunction& fun);

00553       template<class VarInd> void expand(VarInd begin, VarInd end)
00554       {
00555          //*********************************************************************
00556          // Construct the union of the specified variables with this
00557          // functions current domain
00558          //*********************************************************************
00559          std::vector<VarID> newVar = vars_i;
00560          int maxSize = (end - begin) + vars_i.size();
00561          newVar.reserve(maxSize);
00562          newVar.insert(newVar.end(),begin,end);
00563          std::sort(newVar.begin(),newVar.end());
00564 
00565          std::vector<VarID>::iterator newEnd =
00566             std::unique(newVar.begin(),newVar.end());
00567 
00568          newVar.resize(newEnd-newVar.begin());
00569 
00570          //*********************************************************************
00571          // If the specified list is a subset of the current domain, then
00572          // we're done.
00573          //*********************************************************************
00574          if(newVar.size() <= vars_i.size())
00575          {
00576             return;
00577          }
00578 
00579          //*********************************************************************
00580          // Otherwise, create a temporary function to hold this functions new
00581          // value.
00582          //*********************************************************************
00583          DiscreteFunction result(newVar.begin(),newVar.end());
00584 
00585          //*********************************************************************
00586          // Copy old values to new values across the expanded domain
00587          //*********************************************************************
00588          for(DomainIterator k(result); k.hasNext(); ++k)
00589          { 
00590             result(k.getInd()) = (*this)(newVar,k.getSubInd());
00591          }
00592 
00593          //*********************************************************************
00594          // Assign the new values to this one.
00595          //*********************************************************************
00596          result.swap(*this);
00597 
00598       } // expand method
00599

00632       template<class VarIt, class IndIt> void condition
00633       (
00634        VarIt vBegin,
00635        VarIt vEnd,
00636        IndIt iBegin,
00637        IndIt iEnd
00638       )
00639       {
00640          //*********************************************************************
00641          // Construct an iterator for this function's domain, and condition
00642          // on the specified variables.
00643          //*********************************************************************
00644          DomainIterator it(*this);
00645          it.condition(vBegin,vEnd,iBegin,iEnd);
00646 
00647          //*********************************************************************
00648          // If there are no variables to condition on (i.e. the intersection
00649          // of the input variables with this variables domain is empty) then
00650          // there is nothing left to do.
00651          //*********************************************************************
00652          if(0==it.fixedCount())
00653          {
00654             return;
00655          }
00656 
00657          //*********************************************************************
00658          // Otherwise construct the reduced domain of free variables.
00659          //*********************************************************************
00660          std::vector<VarID> freeVars;
00661          freeVars.reserve(vars_i.size());
00662          for(VarIterator varIt=varBegin(); varIt != varEnd(); ++varIt)
00663          {
00664             if(!it.isFixed(*varIt))
00665             {
00666                freeVars.push_back(*varIt);
00667             }
00668          }
00669 
00670          //*********************************************************************
00671          // Create a temporary function to hold the result, and copy in the
00672          // conditioned values.
00673          //*********************************************************************
00674          DiscreteFunction result(freeVars.begin(),freeVars.end());
00675          while(it.hasNext())
00676          {
00677             result(it.getVars(),it.getSubInd()) = this->at(it.getInd());
00678             ++it;
00679          }
00680 
00681          //*********************************************************************
00682          // Finally, swap the result values into this function
00683          //*********************************************************************
00684          result.swap(*this);
00685 
00686       } // condition method

00800     const DiscreteFunction& f2

00848    template<typename F> void marginal
00849    (
00850     const DiscreteFunction& inFun,
00851     F aggregate,
00852     DiscreteFunction& outFun
00853    )
00854    {
00855       //************************************************************************
00856       // Ensure that the domain of outFun is a subset of inFun
00857       // We throw an exception if this is not the case.
00858       //************************************************************************
00859       if(!std::includes(inFun.varBegin(),inFun.varEnd(),
00860                outFun.varBegin(),outFun.varEnd()))
00861       {
00862          throw BadDomainException("marginal(DiscreteFunction,DiscreteFunction)",
00863                "Out domain is not subset of in domain.");
00864       }
00865 
00866       //************************************************************************
00867       // Calculate and store the result for each value in the output function.
00868       // Notice, we need to get the first element outside the loop, so that we
00869       // have at least two values with which to call the aggregate function.
00870       // If there is only one value, then that becomes its own aggregate.
00871       //************************************************************************
00872       for(DomainIterator outIt(outFun); outIt.hasNext(); ++outIt)
00873       {
00874          //*********************************************************************
00875          // Initialise the result to the first corresponding value in the input
00876          // function. This ensures that things like max and min will work
00877          // properly as aggregate functions, because they already have
00878          // something to work with.
00879          //*********************************************************************
00880          DomainIterator inIt(inFun);
00881          inIt.condition(outIt);
00882          ValType result = inFun(inIt.getInd());
00883          ++inIt;
00884 
00885          //*********************************************************************
00886          // Update the result by aggregating with any remaining values in the
00887          // free part of the input function domain.
00888          //*********************************************************************
00889          while(inIt.hasNext())
00890          {
00891             result = aggregate(result,inFun(inIt.getInd()));
00892             ++inIt;
00893          }
00894 
00895          //*********************************************************************
00896          // Store the current aggregate value in the current position of the
00897          // output function.
00898          //*********************************************************************
00899          outFun(outIt.getInd()) = result;
00900 
00901       } // for loop
00902 
00903    } // function marginal
